abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Second Coal Sector
            Adjustment Loan Project are to: a) separate state management
            functions and commercial activities in the industry and
            improve sector governance; b) reduce the impact of the coal
            sector on the federal budget by supporting the decrease of
            subsidies; c) promote the long term efficiency, commercial
            viability and sustainability of the sector, together with
            its privatization; and d) cushion the impact of
            restructuring on coal miners, their families and affected
            communities.  The project consists of five components.  1)
            Commercialization and demonopolization of the coal sector
            will bring about competition among coal companies.  2)
            Privatization and investment will complete privatization of
            about 45 percent of the coal industry by the end of 1998.
            In the interim, any state support will be in the form of
            loans, provided on a competitive basis.  3) Mine closures
            and workforce reductions will be conducted at minimal cost
            and social protection benefits will be provided to all
            eligible persons.  4) Subsidies will be paid to finance
            physical mine closures, scientific research activities,
            severance payments and wage arrears, disability payments,
            and a contingency Social Protection Reserve Fund.  5) Public
            participation and social impact monitoring will inform the
            public regularly about the restructuring program and their
            legal rights, and will consult them on decisions affecting
            their social safety net.
